text: - [Narrator] Imagine accessing the power
of the cloud here or here.
in the most remote locations on Earth,

retro terrestrial connections
aren't resilient enough
or don't exist.

Satellite resiliency for AWS
Outposts extends the power
of the cloud and the reach of AWS services

to the most remote and
distributed locations on Earth.

Since 2019, AWS Outposts
has enabled organizations
to extend their AWS cloud environments,

to edge locations using traditional
terrestrial fixed lines.

Satellite resiliency for AWS
Outposts connects outposts
to low Earth orbit commercial satellites,

enabling connectivity during
outages or interruptions,
strengthening the resiliency of workloads,
and empowering business continuity.
This is particularly useful for scenarios

where there is a need to run
applications and services
close to the edge where the data
is being generated or consumed.

During disruptions, the solution
will automatically select
the best available communications network
with the lowest latency,
and switch again to the next best option
if the main link is disrupted,

giving control over workloads
and high availability.

For the most remote deployments,
such as disaster response,

energy operations,
agriculture, heavy industry,
or security and defense operations,
satellite resiliency for AWS Outposts
provides last mile resiliency.
For more details, please contact us

at
satelliteresiliencyforoutposts@amazon.com.
